questions.question: A group of students participated in a competition to estimate the mass of a jar of marbles. The cumulative frequency diagram below shows the estimation by the students. (a) Use the graph to estimate (i) median, (ii) interquartile range for the mass of the jar of marbles.
(b) Estimate the number of students who answered that the mass of the jar of marbles is at least 500 g.

(c) To increase the difficulty of the competition, the organiser announced that a jar with greater mass of marbles will be used next week. Describe how the cumulative frequency curve for the estimation by students next week will differ from the current competition.
The table below shows the distance, in km, ran by each of the members of a club, in a week. (a) (i) Complete the following cumulative frequency table for the data given.
(b) Find an estimate of the (i) mean of the distance ran, (ii) standard deviation of the distance ran.
questions.question_type: Finding the mean and standard deviation

questions.question: (b) It is given that B = C, find the value of y.

A dance school offers dance sessions for cultural and international dance students on weekdays and weekends. Each student has a 10-week block of lessons with one session per week. The matrix D shows the number of students attending the dance lessons each week in one 10-week block. (a) Evaluate the matrix L = 10D.
The dance school charges $80 for each cultural dance session and $90 for each international dance session. Represent the session charges in a 2x1 column matrix C.
State what the elements of G represent.

The dance school wants to attract more students, so in the next 10-week block, the dance school reduces the price for cultural and international dance session by 10%. For this block of sessions, on weekdays, there are 5 cultural dance students and 12 international dance students. On weekends, there are 8 cultural dance students and 15 international dance students. By using matrix multiplication, calculate the total amount of money the dance school earns for this 10-week block of sessions.
Given that P is the point (1, 1), PQ = (3, -1) and PR = (2, 1), find QR.
Find the coordinates of the point X such that PQXR is a parallelogram.
questions.question_type: Solving a geometric problem involving vectors

questions.question: In the diagram, ABCD is a parallelogram. Y is the midpoint of BD, X is the midpoint of BY and Z is the point on AB such that AB = 3AZ. (a) Given that AZ = 2p and AD = 2q, express as simply as possible, in terms of p and/or q (i) BD.
questions.question_type: Solving a geometric problem involving vectors

questions.question: Express ZY in terms of p and/or q.
Express XC in terms of p and/or q.
Using your answers in (a)(ii) and (a)(iii), deduce two facts about XC and ZY.
questions.question_type: Solving a geometric problem involving vectors
